news_header: An Indian court convicted a police volunteer of the rape and murder of a junior doctor in Kolkata.
news_text: A 33-year-old police volunteer, Sanjoy Roy, was found guilty of raping and murdering a junior doctor in Kolkata last year. The judge confirmed the guilt based on circumstantial evidence, with a sentence expected ranging from life imprisonment to the death penalty. The case, described as 'the rarest of the rare' by federal police, has faced scrutiny from the victim's parents, who believe more than one person was involved. Protests by doctors and citizens continue, demanding justice and better security for women.
